findings.rationale: Limiting liability to only the total license fees paid may expose the Licensee to significant financial risks in case of breaches or failures.
findings.evidence_quote: Each party's liability is limited to the total license fees paid in the preceding calendar year.

findings.rationale: Capping indemnification at $750,000 may not be sufficient to cover potential damages from breaches, especially for larger organizations.
findings.evidence_quote: each party indemnifies the other for claims arising from its own breach, capped at $750,000 per claim.

findings.rationale: The ability to terminate for convenience with only 30 days notice could disrupt business operations and planning.
findings.evidence_quote: Either party may terminate for convenience with 30 days written notice.

findings.rationale: Confidentiality obligations lasting only 3 years may not protect sensitive information adequately if disclosed after that period.
findings.evidence_quote: Confidentiality obligations continue for 3 years after termination of this Agreement.

findings.rationale: Limiting disputes to Virginia courts may be inconvenient for parties located in other jurisdictions.
findings.evidence_quote: Any disputes shall be resolved in the courts of the State of Virginia.
